snippet.title: All-Girls Schools Have No Girl Power
snippet.description:
Over the past decade, there has been a rise in same-sex schooling in the United States. This is done in hopes that schools can increase students' achievement and academic interest, but is it effective? Trace analyzes some recent studies saying that same-sex schooling might not be the best form of education after all. 

Read More:
Single-Sex Education Unlikely To Offer Advantage Over Coed Schools
http://scienceblog.com/70103/single-sex-education-unlikely-to-offer-advantage-over-coed-schools/
"Single-sex education does not educate girls and boys any better than coed schools, according to research published by the American Psychological Association analyzing 184 studies of more than 1.6 million students from around the world."

Gender-Segregated Education in Saudi Arabia: Its Impact on Social Norms and the Saudi Labor Market
http://files.eric.ed.gov/fulltext/EJ852310.pdf
"The article examines the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia's gender-segregated higher education system and how it is used to transmit the Kingdom's traditional societal expectations to the employment sector."

Why Single-Sex Education is Spreading Across the US
http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Latest-News-Wires/2012/0708/Why-single-sex-education-is-spreading-across-the-US/(page)/2
"An estimated 500 public schools across the US now offer some all-boy and all-girl classrooms."

Single-Sex Education Is Assailed in Report
http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/23/education/23single.html
"Single-sex education is ineffective, misguided and may actually increase gender stereotyping, a paper to be published Friday asserts."

Single-Sex Versus Coeducational Schooling: A Systematic Review
http://www.air.org/sites/default/files/downloads/report/Single_Sex_LitReview_091905_0.pdf
"Single-sex education refers most generally to education at the elementary, secondary, or postsecondary level in which males or females attend school exclusively with members of their own sex."

The Case Against Single-Sex Schooling
http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/answer-sheet/post/the-case-against-single-sex-schooling/2012/06/03/gJQA75DNCV_blog.html
"Educators have spent several decades trying - and largely failing - to improve public schools."

Single-Sex Education Unlikely To Offer Advantage Over Coed Schools, Research Finds
http://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2014-02/apa-seu013114.php
"Single-sex education does not educate girls and boys any better than coed schools, according to research published by the American Psychological Association analyzing 184 studies of more than 1.6 million students from around the world."

Single-sex Education: What Does Research Tell Us?
http://ife.ens-lyon.fr/publications/edition-electronique/revue-francaise-de-pedagogie/RF171-5.pdf
"There has been considerable research and policy debate internationally about whether single-sex schooling yields academic and social advantages for girls and/or boys."

The Pseudoscience of Single-Sex Schooling
http://www.womenstudies.wisc.edu/documents/ScienceSingle-sex09-23-11.pdf
"In attempting to improve schools, it is critical to remember that not all reforms lead to meaningful gains for students."
What Are Little Boys Made Of?
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/What_Are_Little_Boys_Made_Of%3F
"'What Are Little Boys Made Of?' is a popular nursery rhyme dating from the early 19th century."

Watch More:
Do School Uniforms Help?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WMetDWhU0z4
TestTube Wild Card
http://testtube.com/dnews/dnews-175-the-truth-about-diamonds?utm_source=YT&utm_medium=DNews&utm_campaign=DNWC
Why Students Need More Sleep
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0t3R9WqEm4M 

____________________
